metadata.title: CVE-2017-15537 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The x86/fpu (Floating Point Unit) subsystem in the Linux kernel before4.13.5, when a processor supports the xsave feature but not the xsavesfeature, does not correctly handle attempts to set reserved bits in thexstate header via the ptrace() or rt_sigreturn() system call, allowinglocal users to read the FPU registers of other processes on the system,related to arch/x86/kernel/fpu/regset.c and arch/x86/kernel/fpu/signal.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15537` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-17-generic - 4.13.0-17.20
linux-image-4.13.0-17-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-17.20
linux-image-4.13.0-17-lowlatency - 4.13.0-17.20
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-17-generic - 4.13.0-17.20
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1006-raspi2 - 4.13.0-1006.6
No subscription required

No subscription required
